image.altText: newspaper clippers with men in black outfits holding a white nationalist banner

props.synopsis: Federal election candidates and elected officials are sharing content from The Noticer, a news site regularly publishing articles promoting white supremacist and neo-Nazi ideologies.

title.children: Neo-Nazis say a news site is their 'biggest weapon' and candidates are spreading it

image.altText: Donald Trump wears a black cap with gold lettering that says 'Make America Great Again'.

props.synopsis: It seems only a matter of time before Donald Trump uses a crisis and the National Emergencies Act to bring about a revolution in the United States.

title.children: Trump's order on showerheads seems trivial but it's a subtle power grab

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Tanya Plibersek air kiss Labor launch

props.synopsis: Tanya Plibersek laughs off the PM seemingly rejecting a hug from her at Labor's launch, insisting the pair are still friends. Follow live.

title.children: Tanya Plibersek laughs off awkward moment with PM

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Key takeaways from Anthony Albanese's press conference
PM won't commit to Plibersek's future in environment portfolio
Plibersek laughs off awkward interaction with PM

image.altText: Two men in suits hold up their right hands in a wave

props.synopsis: It's rare to see a calm, smart and measured former mandarin angry, but I saw that for the first time yesterday when I spoke with Martin Parkinson about the blockbuster Coalition housing announcement.

title.children: Albanese and Dutton's housing policies risk pushing up prices

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: Both major parties used their campaign launches over the weekend to highlight housing announcements targeted squarely at first home buyers. Here's what you need to know about what they're promising.

title.children: How Labor and the Coalition's pitches to first home buyers compare

image.altText: Rory McIlroy on his knees

props.synopsis: Rory McIlroy becomes the sixth man to complete golf's career grand slam, with a dramatic playoff victory at The Masters at Augusta National.

title.children: Career grand slam complete for Rory McIlroy with dramatic Masters win

image.altText: NSW Police officers scour a property on Fernleigh Close, Windellama after a boy was accidentally shot

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to the property in Windellama, near Goulburn, after a firearm was accidentally discharged.

title.children: Two charged after boy killed in accidental shooting on rural NSW property

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin speaks during a news conference.

props.synopsis: In the world of Chinese social media, you don't have to look far to find them — posts encouraging people to join the Russian army are being circulated on accounts with tens of thousands of followers.

title.children: 'Real men are here': The posts luring Chinese men to join Putin's army

image.altText: Three primary school kids holding up small whiteboards and smiling

props.synopsis: One in three Australian students are failing to reach proficiency in maths, and according to a new report, many teachers lack the confidence to teach it.

title.children: 'Too comfortable with mediocrity': 'Faddish' teaching blamed for maths failures

image.altText: A graphic showing a calculator, maths symbols, a ruler and a hand holding a pen

props.synopsis: How are your maths skills? Have a crack at these questions for Year 8 students and see how you compare.

title.children: Can you pass Year 8 maths? Take this quiz to find out

image.altText: Bob Katter smiling in his office.

props.synopsis: Herding Bob Katter is not an easy task for his long-suffering but loyal staff, who battle to keep him on message. But when he wanders, it can turn into viral gold.

title.children: Bob Katter's never lost for words, but there's one topic that's off limits

image.altText: Russia's ambassador to Australia accuses International Criminal Court of bias

props.synopsis: Russia's long-serving ambassador to Australia quietly packs up and returns to Moscow, and there's uncertainty about when his replacement will be approved.

title.children: Russian ambassador leaves Canberra amid uncertainty over replacement

image.altText: A firefighter uses a hose on a burnt out car

props.synopsis: More than 30 civilians were killed after Russian missiles hit the city of Sumy in north-eastern Ukraine, according acting mayor Artem Kobzar, while dozens more were injured.

title.children: Dozens killed in Ukraine's Sumy after Russia's deadliest strike this year

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX is set to rise after Federal Reserve bosses' assurances sparked a Wall Street rally. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set to rise after Wall Street rally on Fed's assurances

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Smartphones get a tariff carve out (for now), China bans rare earth shipment to US
Wall Street bounces on Fed assurances, ASX set to edge higher

image.altText: Donald Trump with his hand in the air as he disembarks a plane

props.synopsis: The details of President Donald Trump's most recent physical exam are revealed, with his doctor saying he is "fully fit" to serve.

title.children: Donald Trump 'fully fit' to serve as president, doctor says

image.altText: a man looks up at a wind turbine

props.synopsis: The Franz family moved to Diamondy, 280 kilometres north-west of Brisbane, for its tranquil nature, but now find themselves surrounded by looming towers.

title.children: Twelve of Australia's tallest wind turbines will surround retired couple's home

image.altText: An aerial shot showing a truck with two trailers on a sand dune, with a pit dug out nearby.

props.synopsis: Residents are questioning why Lancelin's iconic sand dunes are being mined for limesand when they acted as a "perfect fire barrier" during recent bushfires.

title.children: Residents fear mining will remove 'perfect fire barrier' sand dunes

image.altText: An older man with grey hair and a beard staring at the camera.

props.synopsis: John Green was an ABC reporter for 10 years and never thought he'd end up living on the streets. A mental health episode led to a decade sleeping rough.

title.children: Free camping grounds a haven for 'more people than ever' sleeping rough

image.altText: A man wearing glasses with his hand up giving a speech in front of US flag

props.synopsis: Pennsylvania Governor Josh Shapiro and his family are evacuated from their home in the middle of the night after an arsonist set fire to the residence, according to police.

title.children: Arsonists set fire to Pennsylvania governor's home, police say

image.altText: two men facing one another on a dark background one is red and one is blue

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton are vying for your vote. Here’s what sets them apart.

title.children: What sets two of Australia's most powerful men apart from each other

image.altText: A composite image of a Monique Ryan poster and an Amelia Hamer poster.

props.synopsis: While some Kooyong voters in Melbourne's east say teal independent Monique Ryan has performed well, others say they have not seen much change, as the Liberals seek to win back the formerly blue-ribbon seat.

title.children: In Melbourne's leafy east, two candidates fight for a key seat

image.altText: MVDP is hit by a bidon

props.synopsis: Mathieu van der Poel accuses a fan of "attempted manslaughter" after a full bottle of water hit him in the face during the closing stages of the Paris-Roubaix cycling classic.

title.children: Fan accused of 'attempted manslaughter' after throwing water bottle at cyclist

image.altText: Blue and white police tape in front of traffic accident scene

props.synopsis: Police say a van appears to have crashed into the back of two stationary vehicles on Gympie Arterial Road at Bald Hills.

title.children: One woman dead and 10 taken to hospital after Brisbane crash

image.altText: A drone photo overlooking the Tanami mine, you can see a big pit with infrastructure in the background.

props.synopsis: One of the country's most remote mines is getting a billion-dollar upgrade, taking gold production deeper into the Tanami Desert as gold prices hit record highs.

title.children: Australia's remote desert mine plans for 40 more golden years

image.altText: A female toddler with blonde hair sits on the lap of her mother, who is sitting by a garden

props.synopsis: A decade from now, I don't want to be explaining to my daughters why we've still failed to make progress on gynaecological cancers, writes Elise Worthington.

title.children: This cancer killed my mum and could come for my daughters and me

image.altText: A man in a white jumper smiling as he is being hugged by a middleaged brunette woman outside a brick home.

props.synopsis: Todd McKenzie's death is among a number of incidents behind calls by the head of the NSW Police watchdog for the force to embrace body-worn video.

title.children: NSW Police don't always use body-worn camera. The watchdog wants that changed

image.altText: A crowd of visitors take photos and stare at the Mona Lisa painting hanging on a wall at the Louvre.

props.synopsis: The Mona Lisa hasn't always been a huge tourist attraction. It turns out the most famous painting in the world owes its legend to a brazen Italian thief who stole it from the Louvre and vanished for more than two years.

title.children: The smiling woman and a brazen thief: The tale of the missing Mona Lisa

image.altText: A table of real guns and gel blasters demonstrates how difficult it is to tell the difference.

props.synopsis: Gel blasters look identical to handguns, shotguns and rifles, making it hard even for officers to tell the difference between a toy and a real gun.

title.children: Six people wielding gel blasters shot by Queensland police

image.altText: An Aboriginal man wearing protective gloves holding a hot container with heated grass in it.

props.synopsis: In far west New South Wales, two Aboriginal men are drawing on the traditional knowledge of their ancestors to generate a source of income.

title.children: Aboriginal entrepreneurs harness ancient knowledge for new businesses

image.altText: An oval sign under a shop verandah saying sacat.

props.synopsis: A South Australian nurse has been reprimanded by South Australia's Civil and Administrative Tribunal after admitting to fabricating documents in a bid to gain employment.

title.children: SA nurse banned after committing 'serious' professional misconduct

image.altText: Two grain silos collapsed with grain pouring into the Shoalhaven River

props.synopsis: Workers at a plant where two silos collapsed last year are at risk of serious injury or death, according to dozens of improvement notices issued by the NSW safety regulator.

title.children: Workers exposed to 'unbelievable' risks at plant where silos collapsed

image.altText: An older man and a younger woman look offscreen at something

props.synopsis: Star-studded satirical horror Death of a Unicorn is a refreshingly unique offering in a sea of remakes and reboots.

title.children: Killer unicorns offer a fresh take on the 'eat the rich' satire
